alert.note: Alert for Cook (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued July 12 at 6:25PM CDT until July 12 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM CDT FOR EAST CENTRAL COOK COUNTY... At 625 PM CDT, a confirmed large and extremely dangerous tornado was located over Stickney, or over Berwyn, moving northeast at 35 mph. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. TAKE COVER NOW! HAZARD...Damaging tornado. SOURCE...Radar confirmed tornado. IMPACT...You are in a life-threatening situation. Flying debris may be deadly to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be destroyed. Considerable damage to homes, businesses, and vehicles is likely and complete destruction is possible. The tornado will be near... Austin around 630 PM CDT. South Lawndale, Bridgeport, Brighton Park, New City and East Garfield Park around 635 PM CDT. West Town, Irving Park, Navy Pier, Northerly Island, Near West Side, Humboldt Park and Logan Square around 640 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this tornadic thunderstorm include Chicago, Chicago Loop, Lincoln Park, Lake View, Near North Side, Uptown and Edgewater. This includes... Lincoln Park Zoo, Hawthorne Park, Soldier Field, University of Illinois Chicago, Guaranteed Rate Field...IL Institute of Technology, Wrigley Field, The Loop, Museum Campus, and Northerly Island. Including the following interstates... I-55 between mile markers 283 and 294. I-94 between mile markers 46 and 56. I-290 between mile markers 23 and 29. I-294 between mile markers 46 and 56. OEMC zones...TORNADO WARNING. 2...3...4...5...6...7...and 8. TORNADO...OBSERVED TORNADO DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a large, extremely dangerous and potentially deadly tornado is on the ground. To protect your life, TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
